intro: Centaurea guilhelmi, commonly known as the Spanish thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are usually spiny and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue or purple in color. Centaurea guilhelmi is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
